Second, the explanation, divided into six as in the treatise. Seven, clarifying the virtue of not accepting greed and other afflictions, divided into two.
First, establishing the cause.
Second, revealing the effect. Eight, clarifying the virtue of the mind being impartial, etc., divided into five.
First, clarifying the virtue of the mind being impartial.
Second, clarifying the virtue of receiving offerings.
Third, clarifying the virtue of abiding in the remainder of the basis.
Fourth, clarifying the virtue of reaching the other shore.
Fifth, clarifying the virtue of abiding in the subsequent existence. Nine, clarifying the virtue of abiding in the remainderless basis, divided into three.
First, establishing the cause.
Second, revealing the effect.
Third, clarifying the essence and characteristics of the uncontaminated realm, divided into two.
First, clarifying the non-existence.
Second, clarifying the existence, divided into two.
First, the thesis.
Second, the explanation. Ten, clarifying the virtue of not being intimate with the five places, etc., divided into two.
First, the thesis.

The eleventh clarifies the virtue of leaving behind wrong views, which is divided into five parts as in the treatise. The twelfth clarifies the virtue of leaving behind fear. The thirteenth clarifies the stage of the intention of final practice. The fourteenth clarifies the stage of the intention of the fruit of final practice. The fifteenth clarifies the general conclusion. The sixteenth clarifies the meaning of the stage, which is divided into three parts.
First, the thesis.
Second, the explanation. Third, the establishment of the analogy.
